topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the RabbitMQ Patch

section.p: This patch fixes a problem with the logging of the RabbitMQ service installed on HP Helion OpenStack CarrierGrade. RabbitMQ was consuming excessive memory. After deploying this patch, the memory for the Elasticsearch service will be set to 50% of free memory. If the free memory exceeds 32g then the memory will be set to 32g as recommended by Elasticsearch guidelines.

In addition, this patch includes a script file that will delete Logstash logs greater than eight (8) days old. The script file can be found on each controller in the /var/lib/hlm/elastic_cleanup.sh directory. Modify cleanup schedule by changing the DAYS variable in that file. .
If any of your HP Helion OpenStack controllers has the elastic_cleanup.sh script in the /var/lib/hlm/ directory, this patch was installed during installation. You can disregard these steps.

body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the rabbitmq.patch and readme files are available.
The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.

ol.li:
Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the file to the ~/ directory.
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../rabbitmq.patch
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:./hlm_prepare-env.sh
Execute the following command:hlm generate -c <cloud name>
Execute the following command on all tiers: hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "ELK-SCH"
